website_summaries.verdict: Overall, the Altra Olympus 3.5 has received a lot of praise because of its fantastic construction. With its comfortable fit and excellent cushioning, many users are happy and satisfied. To win the majority of the consumers, this versatile shoe makes sure to perform well on different walking, hiking, and running activities. Despite the issues on its price and bulky look, others still lauded its fantastic construction. The Altra Olympus 3.5 is recommended by many to those who want to be successful in tackling difficult and dangerous trail-running activities.
pros: Some of the testers commented that the Altra Olympus 3.5 is comfortable
The shoe is best for hiking as well as road and trail running activities, according to a few buyers
Based on reviews, the shoe has been praised for its wide toe box
Several purchasers said that the Olympus 3.5 provides excellent traction
One of the consumers loves the snug fit that the shoe delivers
According to those who have tested it, the shoe is well-cushioned
cons: One of the reviewers said that the Altra Olympus 3.5 is expensive
A tester noted that the shoe feels heavy and looks bulky
According to a user, the Olympus 3.5 does not drain very well

customer_reviews.title: Not just for running, great cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable and not just for running. I’ve got two other pairs of altar shoes and I’m really glad I went for these. I’m not a runner I use these for work. In the medical field I’m on my feet a lot and the cushion these provide is amazing. I laugh at those comments that they were a little heavy, really?! How can you tell such a tiny bit of difference? The comfort more then makes up for that insignificant thing. Great shoe for walking as well as running you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe?
customer_reviews.text: Got a pair of the olympus 3.5 2 weeks ago. I've been using the 3.0 for the past year. The 3.5 feels amazing. I've summited 4 large mountain peaks in these, put on 70 miles and 25k vert. The shoe is perfect for me. I will buy several in my size (1/2 size larger than I buy with other shoes) and stockpile them for a few years use. Lots of cushion, good traction, even great on the road for me
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe for big runners....
customer_reviews.text: If you are a 100 kilo plus person this shoe will probably save your knees and feet. I run 30-50 Kilometres a week and find them more comfortable and supportive than the previous version. I need a wide toe box and wear a size 11 UK (buy US 12). I run on/off road and find them quite neutral and well supported. If you haven’t run on zero drop shoes it will take you a few runs to get used to them. I am not a speed demon but enjoy easy paced long runs.
customer_reviews.author: sean hanns

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a maximally padded shoe? Very comfortable, and great grip On any surface. I love Altras because I have wide feet, and the Altra toe box gives me the room I need. If you need to feel the trail, these are not the shoes for you, But if your feet need protection from roots & rocks, you can’t go wrong with the Olympus!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Flanagan Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This is an extremely comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I guess this is a running shoe, but I just use it for walking. It is extremely comfortable in every way...I have a history of plantar fasciitis, and so have very sensitive heels. These shoes are great. One caution - I have a pair of Olympus 2.0 which fit and feel identical to these, but have started to deteriorate much sooner than I expected. The shoes aren't cheap, and maybe won't last that long...but they sure feel good!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Goofy and over-priced.
customer_reviews.text: I have much brand loyalty when it comes to Altra but these were a no-go for me. Having come from the escalante 1.5 I was eager to update to what many Altra fans consider a great marathoner shoe. I was disappointed in how the sizing strayed from the sizing standards on the escalante 1.5 and found that movement in these shoes were uncomfortable and restricting. For a company that places so much emphasis on natural gait and movement, it is odd Altra would sell such a goofy, over-cushioned "running" shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Croce

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but they don't last
customer_reviews.text: I have worn out a number of pairs of these shoes. We use them for distance walking, about 30-50 miles per week. The last couple of pairs have not lasted as long as the older pairs used to. The shoes look ok, but the midsole breaks down and the lack of structure causes foot pain. Its a shame because these are great shoes at first.
customer_reviews.author: cpu

customer_reviews.title: Etter than hoka
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and an amazing amoubt of room in the toe box. Don’t let the high heel scare you, this isn’t a hoka and feels much better
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mosel

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Really great shoe fog anyone struggling with physical limitations, such as neuropathy. The wide, natural foot box is great.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: I can wear these shoes all day.
customer_reviews.text: The Altra Olympus makes me feel like I'm walking on a soft carpet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, beautiful and comfortable , ten stars for sure!!!!
customer_reviews.text: First they look awesome!, really they are a work of art, beautiful , the fit is as expected and they are extremely comfortable shoes. This is my first time using Altra's sneakers and I'm a fan, don't know if Altra is a well known brand but who cares one thing for sure this are the best sneakers I have in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Rommel Lagrange

customer_reviews.title: Too small, and not new
customer_reviews.text: I always wear size 14, but these are too small. They are also very dirty, obviously not new. They have me someone's worn and filthy old shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Get the Hoka Bondi 6, and don’t waste your time or money on the Altra Olympus. PERIOD!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried these after the Hoka One One Bondi 6, since so many others had compared them as being very similar. Totally unwarranted. These are nothing more than a very cheap version of the Hoka Bondi. Can’t even come close. Not even in the same league. Not inexpensive either, so don’t waste your money. Buy the best, the Hoka Bondi 6.
customer_reviews.author: Steven F.

customer_reviews.title: Great padding, Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a variety of shoes and due to the amount of running I do each week this shoe provides extra padding on my long runs which really helps me feel better post run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squishy all around
customer_reviews.text: Squishy. Very nice squishyness. No real lateral support to speak of.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Pershouse

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice comfortable shoe. Fits great, big toe box, zero drop, and great cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Bad shoe
customer_reviews.text: To heavy and bulky and just a very bad fit very uncomfortable,the worst running shoe I have ever had by far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: great shoe. a little narrow for me but i do have a wide foot. had to return.
customer_reviews.author: J Bender

customer_reviews.title: Soo comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nice color great fit tempted to buy another pair but with Covid no real need.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Running with the Gods
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for running or walking. I like the springy and lightweight feel of these shoes. Also very comfortable and look awesome! I highly recommend Altra.
customer_reviews.author: Gianpaulo P.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes ever! This is my fourth pair of the Olympus. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Bronco fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Probably want to order a half size up
customer_reviews.text: Great product, and the company is fair enough, but during Covid I couldn't risk sending them back. However, my 20 something son -- they fit him perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bible believer

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking
customer_reviews.text: I use these for walking on hard surfaces mostly. Very comfortable and cushioning. The wide toe box is really good. Thanks for a great product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Most comfort you can get!
customer_reviews.text: I Love those!! I had Timp 1.5 before and those have so much more cushion. Very comfortable. As with all the good shoes - I will stock up on em!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great and fast seller for a quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Am a fan of Altra however this is my first time ordering a pair of shoe online. Purchase arrived earlier than expected. Fits perfectly. Very happy with seller Marathon Sports.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Tan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cushioned shoe
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe, very cushioned. I have a low arch and these fit my needs. I wear a 10.5 in most of the Hoka shoes, in this Altra, I used the Altra size chart which recommended a 10, and the 10 fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great trail runner for rugged hikes
customer_reviews.text: Great trail runner that I use to hike the rugged Long Trail in Vermont. The additional cushioning allows for rugged hiking with minimal foot soreness after hiking 8-10 miles per day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Smart buy
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of sneakers I ever owned no back pain when I wear them
customer_reviews.author: lisa mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: These shoes allow me to walk with very arthritic large toe joints that need fused.
customer_reviews.author: J. Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Good trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: A lot of room in the toe box. Really appreciate the cushioning especially on the more technical trails. Overall a great show to hike and/or trail run in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for comfort
customer_reviews.text: Liked fit, comfort. Product came like some one had been trying shoe on and returned it . Shoe was clean tho
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Only Altra
customer_reviews.text: I love Altra running shoes. These maximalists are great for those of use older runners.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Love all the cushion they have great for hiking on trails
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Delivered a day earlier than expected and the fit was perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and a day early with the delivery!!! I’m so impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Shane L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Epic
customer_reviews.text: Very good trail shoe. If you like max cushioning, this trainer is epic.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith.

customer_reviews.title: more narrow that the superior 3.5
customer_reviews.text: I got these on a warehouse deal so for the price they are great, but if I had paid full retail I would be disappointed. These sit a little higher off the ground and have great cushioning for big bodied runners like me. But the toe box is smaller than what I have experienced in other altra shoes.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Vibram sole disintegrates after 200 miles
customer_reviews.text: I had all the versions of Olympus. This 3.5 the so called Vibram sole disintegrates after 200 miles. Horrible testing. I called Altra several times and one guy told me they are "not supposed to last more than 300 miles". FOR $150????
customer_reviews.author: Bogie D

customer_reviews.title: Goofy!
customer_reviews.text: I’d love to replace my last pair of Olympus, but the color options this time are ridiculous. Why in the world does this company think everyone wants clown shoes? Offer a simple black option for every shoe, Altra—we’re begging you.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Really confortable on stony ground
customer_reviews.text: Daily 2 mi walk on stony ground was causing tender feet and I was having trouble finding cushion with extra width. My (discontinued) Altra Olympus 9062FT, purchased at a running store, are the most comfortable walking or running shoes yet encountered. And as one reviewer pointed out, also very nice for wearing about the house.
customer_reviews.author: Parby Grylam

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Durability
customer_reviews.text: Weak vamp on an otherwise very comfortable shoe. I've had two pairs already and am returning the second pair after around 60 miles, pair that is in pictures had about 145 miles on them. If they had combined the durability of the new Timps with the Olympus it would have been a perfect shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best trail runners I’ve had so far
customer_reviews.text: Using for backpacking and running. Lots of cushion, good tread, good fit. Runs small like all altras. I will buy these for my next pair. Before this I had the 2.5, they fixed the weird overcushioning by the heel
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Santos

customer_reviews.title: Still the best max cushion trail runner for BIG men
customer_reviews.text: This shoe gets better with each generation. I have every version since 2.0 this is the best. I wear them every and they really protect feet from everything. Replace about every 6 months. Keep the old ones for rough dirty work.
customer_reviews.author: RU12HI5

product_meta.title: ALTRA Olympus 3.5 Trail Running Shoes - SS20
product_meta.description: Altra Olympus 3.5 Trail Running Shoes The Olympus 3.5 has been revamped for more support, stability and traction on any terrain. A breathable mesh upper is coupled with a flexible and responsive midsole whilst a Vibram Megagrip outsole ensure traction in varied conditions. Breathable Mesh Upper Engineered mesh uppers will encase each foot in breathable comfort. Lightweight and highly breathable for all-temperature comfort, the mesh acts as a lightweight second skin, providing a supportive and comfortable fit. Its perforated construction allows air to fully permeate the entire upper, letting your feet breathe when the temperature starts to rise or your training session heats up. The upper is also highly durable thanks to synthetic overlays which swathe the upper for increased support. The abrasion-resistant overlays provide enhanced durability to reduce the risks of chafing and irritation. The upper construction also features foot-shape technology which allows the toes to be relaxed within the shoe. It allows them to spread out naturally with the big toe remaining in a straight position for additional comfort, speed and stability. An Altra-exclusive GaiterTrap has been updated to a new 4-point system to keep an attached gaiter even more secure than before, thus preventing debris from entering the shoe. Completing the upper is a lacing system which locks down the midfoot to reduce in-shoe slippage so you can enjoy distraction-free strides. EVA Midsole A full-length platform of EVA resides underfoot for lightweight, responsive cushioning. Generous, soft and durable, it spares your joints as you strike down onto hard, unforgiving surfaces. Exceptionally lightweight, the EVA ensures long-lasting cushioning to keep you comfortable on long-distance days. EVA is extremely firm, which will absorb shocks instantly and effectively, preventing them from causing any damage to the sole of the foot. The energy produced from this will also be returned as rebound, which
feature_bullets: Provides surprising stability on uneven surfaces
